Text:
You were on the right track, but you made a few mistakes: - You have two variables with the same name. - You have two functions with the same name. - If a function expects an argument, you must always send an argument (or `null`), you can not only send `-1` for left, and nothing for right. (And in your case, you're actually making it more difficult by not sending a `1` for right). - This `|| imgs[dir ? imgs.length - 1 : 0]`, just doesn't make any sense. I'm guessing you wanted to prevent an invalid src (outside of the array's scope), but it does something else entirely.
That whole line in fact WILL NOT work the way you think, because as far as the code is concerned, the first condition is always true. That the src doesn't really exist on your server doesn't matter to the JS code. That will only cause a server error (404 Not Found). Below is your code with those issues fixed: --- *(I changed `.src` to `.alt` for the answer's sake, so you won't get any 404 errors for missing sources, and you can see it working (press F12 to open console).
But on your website, you should obviously change `.alt` back to `.src` again.)* **JS, HTML:** var imgs = ["1.jpg", "2.jpg", "3.jpg", "4.jpg", "5.jpg"]; document.onkeydown = function(event) { var e = event || window.event; if (e.keyCode == '37') { //LEFT changeImage(-1); } else if (e.keyCode == '39') { //RIGHT changeImage(1); } } function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); var newSrc = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.alt)+dir]; //set the new src, but only if it's in the imgs-array (i.e. if it exists) if (imgs.indexOf(newSrc) != -1) { img.alt = newSrc; } console.log(document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange").alt); }
(**fiddle: http://jsfiddle.net/k3wxhc58/2/**)

You were on the right track, but you made a few mistakes: - You have two variables with the same name. - You have two functions with the same name. - If a function expects an argument, you must always send an argument (or `null`), you can not only send `-1` for left, and nothing for right. (And in your case, you're actually making it more difficult by not sending a `1` for right). - This `|| imgs[dir ? imgs.length - 1 : 0]`, just doesn't make any sense. I'm guessing you wanted to prevent an invalid src (outside of the array's scope), but it does something else entirely.
That whole line in fact WILL NOT work the way you think, because as far as the code is concerned, the first condition is always true. That the src doesn't really exist on your server doesn't matter to the JS code. That will only cause a server error (404 Not Found). Below is your code with those issues fixed: --- *(I changed `.src` to `.alt` for the answer's sake, so you won't get any 404 errors for missing sources, and you can see it working (press F12 to open console).
But on your website, you should obviously change `.alt` back to `.src` again.)* **JS, HTML:** var imgs = ["1.jpg", "2.jpg", "3.jpg", "4.jpg", "5.jpg"]; document.onkeydown = function(event) { var e = event || window.event; if (e.keyCode == '37') { //LEFT changeImage(-1); } else if (e.keyCode == '39') { //RIGHT changeImage(1); } } function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); var newSrc = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.alt)+dir]; //set the new src, but only if it's in the imgs-array (i.e. if it exists) if (imgs.indexOf(newSrc) != -1) { img.alt = newSrc; } console.log(document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange").alt); }
(**fiddle: http://jsfiddle.net/k3wxhc58/2/**) ---
UPDATE - After reading your question again, I understand you want the sources to loop. For that, change the `changeImage()` function to this: function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); //set the new src if (imgs.indexOf(img.alt)==0 && dir==-1) { //FIRST img.alt = imgs[imgs.length-1]; //loop to last } else if (imgs.indexOf(img.alt)==imgs.length-1 && dir==1) { //LAST img.alt = imgs[0]; //loop to first } else { img.alt = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.alt)+dir]; } } See the snippet below for this effect: var imgs = ["1.jpg", "2.jpg", "3.jpg", "4.jpg", "5.jpg"]; document.onkeydown = function(event) { var e = event || window.event; if (e.keyCode == '37') { //LEFT changeImage(-1); } else if (e.keyCode == '39') { //RIGHT changeImage(1); } } function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); //set the new src if (imgs.indexOf(img.alt)==0 && dir==-1) { //FIRST img.alt = imgs[imgs.length-1]; //loop to last } else if (imgs.indexOf(img.alt)==imgs.length-1 && dir==1) { //LAST img.alt = imgs[0]; //loop to first } else { img.alt = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.alt)+dir]; } console.log(document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange").alt); }
(**fiddle: http://jsfiddle.net/k3wxhc58/3/**)

But on your website, you should obviously change `.alt` back to `.src` again.)* **JS, HTML:** var imgs = ["1.jpg", "2.jpg", "3.jpg", "4.jpg", "5.jpg"]; document.onkeydown = function(event) { var e = event || window.event; if (e.keyCode == '37') { //LEFT changeImage(-1); } else if (e.keyCode == '39') { //RIGHT changeImage(1); } } function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); var newSrc = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.alt)+dir]; //set the new src, but only if it's in the imgs-array (i.e. if it exists) if (imgs.indexOf(newSrc) != -1) { img.alt = newSrc; } console.log(document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange").alt); }

For that, change the `changeImage()` function to this: function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); //set the new src if (dir==-1 && imgs.indexOf(img.alt)==0) { //FIRST img.alt = imgs[imgs.length-1]; //loop to last } else if (dir==1 && imgs.indexOf(img.alt)==imgs.length-1) { //LAST img.alt = imgs[0]; //loop to first } else { img.alt = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.alt)+dir]; } } See the snippet below for this effect: var imgs = ["1.jpg", "2.jpg", "3.jpg", "4.jpg", "5.jpg"]; document.onkeydown = function(event) { var e = event || window.event; if (e.keyCode == '37') { //LEFT changeImage(-1); } else if (e.keyCode == '39') { //RIGHT changeImage(1); } } function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); //set the new src if (dir==-1 && imgs.indexOf(img.alt)==0) { //FIRST img.alt = imgs[imgs.length-1]; //loop to last } else if (dir==1 && imgs.indexOf(img.alt)==imgs.length-1) { //LAST img.alt = imgs[0]; //loop to first } else { img.alt = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.alt)+dir]; } console.log(document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange").alt); }

Comment: Changed the `if-clauses` so it first checks for `dir` (which is lighter)

Text:
You were on the right track, but you made a few mistakes: - You have two variables with the same name. - You have two functions with the same name. - If a function expects an argument, you must always send an argument (or `null`), you can not only send `-1` for left, and nothing for right. (And in your case, you're actually making it more difficult for yourself by not sending a `1` for right). - `|| imgs[dir ? imgs.length - 1 : 0]`, doesn't do what you think it does. I'm guessing you wanted to prevent an invalid src (outside of the array's scope), but it does something else entirely.
That whole line in fact WILL NOT work the way you think, because as far as the code is concerned, the first condition is always true. The code doesn't care that the src doesn't actually exist on your server, that will just cause a server error (404 Not Found). Below is your code with those issues fixed: --- *(I changed `.src` to `.alt` for the answer's sake, so you won't get any 404 errors for missing sources, and you can see it working (press F12 to open console).
But on your website, you should obviously change `.alt` back to `.src` again.)* **JS, HTML:** var imgs = ["1.jpg", "2.jpg", "3.jpg", "4.jpg", "5.jpg"]; document.onkeydown = function(event) { var e = event || window.event; if (e.keyCode == '37') { //LEFT changeImage(-1); } else if (e.keyCode == '39') { //RIGHT changeImage(1); } } function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); var newSrc = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.alt)+dir]; //set the new src, but only if it's in the imgs-array (i.e. if it exists) if (imgs.indexOf(newSrc) != -1) { img.alt = newSrc; } console.log(document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange").alt); }
(**fiddle: http://jsfiddle.net/k3wxhc58/2/**) --- UPDATE - After reading your question again, I understand you want the sources to loop. For that, change the `changeImage()` function to this: function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); //set the new src if (dir==-1 && imgs.indexOf(img.alt)==0) { //FIRST img.alt = imgs[imgs.length-1]; //loop to last } else if (dir==1 && imgs.indexOf(img.alt)==imgs.length-1) { //LAST img.alt = imgs[0]; //loop to first } else { img.alt = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.alt)+dir]; } } See the snippet below for this effect: var imgs = ["1.jpg", "2.jpg", "3.jpg", "4.jpg", "5.jpg"]; document.onkeydown = function(event) { var e = event || window.event; if (e.keyCode == '37') { //LEFT changeImage(-1); } else if (e.keyCode == '39') { //RIGHT changeImage(1); } } function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); //set the new src if (dir==-1 && imgs.indexOf(img.alt)==0) { //FIRST img.alt = imgs[imgs.length-1]; //loop to last } else if (dir==1 && imgs.indexOf(img.alt)==imgs.length-1) { //LAST img.alt = imgs[0]; //loop to first } else { img.alt = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.alt)+dir]; } console.log(document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange").alt); }
(**fiddle: http://jsfiddle.net/k3wxhc58/4/**)

You were on the right track, but you made a few mistakes: - You have two variables with the same name. - You have two functions with the same name. - If a function expects an argument, you must always send an argument (or `null`), you can not only send `-1` for left, and nothing for right. (And in your case, you're actually making it more difficult for yourself by not sending a `1` for right). - `|| imgs[dir ? imgs.length - 1 : 0]`, doesn't do what you think it does. You're checking `dir` as if it's a boolean. JavaScript can interpret `1` and `-1` as booleans (`true` and `false` respectively), but because you only send along `-1` it will not work correctly. Below is your code with these issues fixed: --- **JS, HTML:** var imgs = ["1.jpg", "2.jpg", "3.jpg", "4.jpg", "5.jpg"]; document.onkeydown = function(event) { var e = event || window.event; if (e.keyCode == '37') { //LEFT changeImage(-1); } else if (e.keyCode == '39') { //RIGHT changeImage(1); } } function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); img.alt = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.alt)+dir] || imgs[(dir==1) ? 0 : imgs.length-1]; console.log(document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange").alt); }
(**fiddle: http://jsfiddle.net/k3wxhc58/5/**) - In the ternary operator, instead of `(dir==1)` you could just use `dir`, since JavaScript translates a `1` to `true`. But using `(dir==1)` is safer because that will create a real boolean. - I changed `.src` to `.alt` for the answer's sake, so you won't get any 404 errors for missing sources, and you can see it working (press F12 to open console).
But on your website, you should obviously change `.alt` back to `.src` again. --- UPDATE - If you don't want the sources to loop, change the `changeImage()` function to this: function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); var newSrc = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.alt)+dir]; if (imgs.indexOf(newSrc) != -1) { img.alt = newSrc; } } (**fiddle: http://jsfiddle.net/k3wxhc58/2/**)
Comment: Incorporated this: `imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.alt)+dir] || imgs[(dir==1) ? 0 : imgs.length-1]` into the answer

Text:
You were on the right track, but you got a few things wrong: - You have two variables with the same name. - You have two functions with the same name. - If a function expects an argument, you must always send an argument (or `null`), you can not only send `-1` for left, and nothing for right. (And in your case, you're actually making it more difficult for yourself by not sending a `1` for right). - `|| imgs[dir ? imgs.length - 1 : 0]`, doesn't do what you think it does. You're checking `dir` as if it's a boolean. JavaScript can interpret `1` and `-1` as booleans (`true` and `false` respectively), but because you only send along `-1` it will not work correctly. Below is your code with these issues fixed: --- **JS, HTML:** var imgs = ["http://i.stack.imgur.com/NjC6V.jpg", "http://i.stack.imgur.com/0eBBQ.gif", "http://i.stack.imgur.com/uhjjB.png", "http://i.stack.imgur.com/cNhjf.jpg", "http://i.stack.imgur.com/Dn175.png"]; document.onkeydown = function(event) { var e = event || window.event; if (e.keyCode == '37') { //LEFT changeImage(-1); } else if (e.keyCode == '39') { //RIGHT changeImage(1); } } function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); img.src = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.src)+dir] || imgs[(dir==1) ? 0 : imgs.length-1]; } #imgClickAndChange { width: 150px; height: 150px; }
(**fiddle: http://jsfiddle.net/k3wxhc58/8/**) - In the ternary operator, instead of `(dir==1)` you could just use `dir`, since JavaScript translates a `1` to `true`. But using `(dir==1)` is safer because that will create a real boolean. - I replaced the image sources in the `imgs`-array with links to images that actually exist, so the script works without any errors. - I added some CSS, this is only for the answers sake, so that all images have the same size. --- **If you don't want the sources to loop, change the `changeImage()` function to this:** function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); var newSrc = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.src)+dir]; if (imgs.indexOf(newSrc) != -1) { //only sets new src if it's in the imgs-array (i.e. if it exists) img.src = newSrc; } } (**fiddle: http://jsfiddle.net/k3wxhc58/9/**)
Comment: Changed `img.alt` to `img.src` for a more accurate example.

Text:
You were on the right track, but you got a few things wrong: - You have two variables with the same name. - You have two functions with the same name. - If a function expects an argument, you must always send an argument (or `null`), you can not only send `-1` for left, and nothing for right. (And in your case, you're actually making it more difficult for yourself by not sending a `1` for right). - `|| imgs[dir ? imgs.length - 1 : 0]`, doesn't do what you think it does. You're checking `dir` as if it's a boolean. JavaScript can interpret `1` and `-1` as booleans (`true` and `false` respectively), but because you only send along `-1` it will not work correctly. Below is your code with these issues fixed: --- **JS, HTML:** var imgs = ["http://i.stack.imgur.com/NjC6V.jpg", "http://i.stack.imgur.com/0eBBQ.gif", "http://i.stack.imgur.com/uhjjB.png", "http://i.stack.imgur.com/cNhjf.jpg", "http://i.stack.imgur.com/Dn175.png"]; document.onkeydown = function(event) { var e = event || window.event; if (e.keyCode == '37') { //LEFT changeImage(-1); } else if (e.keyCode == '39') { //RIGHT changeImage(1); } } function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); img.src = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.src)+dir] || imgs[(dir==1) ? 0 : imgs.length-1]; } #imgClickAndChange { width: 150px; height: 150px; }
(**fiddle: http://jsfiddle.net/k3wxhc58/8/**) - In the ternary operator, instead of `(dir==1)` you could just use `dir`, since JavaScript translates a `1` to `true`. But using `(dir==1)` is safer because that will create a real boolean. - I replaced the images in the `imgs`-array with links to images that actually exist, so the script works without any errors. - I added some CSS, this is only for the answer's sake, so that all images have the same size. --- **If you don't want the sources to loop, change the `changeImage()` function to this:** function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); var newSrc = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.src)+dir]; if (imgs.indexOf(newSrc) != -1) { //only sets new src if it's in the imgs-array (i.e. if it exists) img.src = newSrc; } } (**fiddle: http://jsfiddle.net/k3wxhc58/9/**)

You were on the right track, but you got a few things wrong: - You have two variables with the same name. - You have two functions with the same name. - If a function expects an argument, you must always send an argument (or `null`), you can not only send `-1` for left, and nothing for right. (And in your case, you're actually making it more difficult for yourself by not sending a `1` for right). - `|| imgs[dir ? imgs.length - 1 : 0]`, doesn't do what you think it does. You're checking `dir` as if it's a boolean. JavaScript can interpret `1` and `-1` as booleans (`true` and `false` respectively), but because you only send along `-1` it will not work correctly. Below is your code with these issues fixed: --- **JS, HTML:** var imgs = ["http://i.stack.imgur.com/NjC6V.jpg", "http://i.stack.imgur.com/0eBBQ.gif", "http://i.stack.imgur.com/uhjjB.png", "http://i.stack.imgur.com/cNhjf.jpg", "http://i.stack.imgur.com/Dn175.png"]; document.onkeydown = function(event) { var e = event || window.event; if (e.keyCode == '37') { //LEFT changeImage(-1); } else if (e.keyCode == '39') { //RIGHT changeImage(1); } } function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); img.src = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.src)+dir] || imgs[(dir==1) ? 0 : imgs.length-1]; } #imgClickAndChange { width: 150px; height: 150px; }
(**fiddle: http://jsfiddle.net/k3wxhc58/8/**) - In the ternary operator, instead of `(dir==1)` you could just use `dir`, since JavaScript translates a `1` to `true`. But using `(dir==1)` is safer because that will create a real boolean. - I replaced the images in the `imgs`-array with links to images that actually exist, so that the script works without any errors. - I added some CSS, this is only for the answer's sake, so that all images have the same size. --- **If you don't want the images to loop, change the `changeImage()` function to this:** function changeImage(dir) { var img = document.getElementById("imgClickAndChange"); var newSrc = imgs[imgs.indexOf(img.src)+dir]; if (imgs.indexOf(newSrc) != -1) { //only sets new src if it's in the imgs-array (i.e. if it exists) img.src = newSrc; } } (**fiddle: http://jsfiddle.net/k3wxhc58/9/**)
